portabout.para: NetBSD/pdp10 is a suggested port of NetBSD to DEC PDP-10 computers, their clones, and PDP-10 software emulators. Currently the effort is one that is mainly investigative; it involves discussions on the port-pdp10@NetBSD.org and some early development work. The NetBSD/pdp10 port specifically targets those PDP-10 processor implementations that support the extended addressing mode. Systems in this category include the DECSYSTEM-2060 and the DECSYSTEM-2065. Additionally, there are a number of PDP-10 clones supporting extended addressing including machines made by Foonly, SC Group, and XKL.

Due to a number of factors, mostly the impracticality of obtaining and running one of the capable PDP-10 systems, the NetBSD/pdp10 efforts will, at least initially, be concentrated on porting to Ken Harrenstien's KLH10 PDP-10 software emulator. The primary reason being that, of the several freely available emulators, it is the only one which emulates PDP-10 extended addressing.

portinfo.portinfoitem: PDP-10 port of GCC from Lars Brinkhoff
KLH10 PDP-10 Emulator by Ken Harrenstien
portinfo.portlinkitem: DEC PDP-10 Emulation Page of Zane Healy

portnews.portnewsitem: NetBSD 2.0 released with support for 48 architectures. More information is available in the 2.0 release announcement.
The NetBSD/pdp10 mailing list has been created for the discussion of topics related to the NetBSD/pdp10 porting effort.

portnewsitem.title: PDP-10 port for GCC undergoes trials

portnews.portnewsitem: Lars Brinkhoff's PDP-10 port of GCC begins trials at XKL.
